# _Madam Secretary_ (season 4)

Jump to: navigation, search

_Madam Secretary_ (season 4)  
---  
Country of origin | United States  
No. of episodes | 22  
Release  
Original network | [CBS](/wiki/CBS "CBS")  
Original release | October 8, 2017 (2017-10-08) – May 20, 2018 (2018-05-20)  
Season chronology  
← **Previous**  
[Season 3](/wiki/Madam_Secretary_\(season_3\) "Madam Secretary \(season 3\)")  
[List of _Madam Secretary_ episodes](/wiki/List_of_Madam_Secretary_episodes

The fourth season of the American [political drama](/wiki/Political_drama
"Political drama") series _[Madam
Secretary](/wiki/Madam_Secretary_\(TV_series\) "Madam Secretary \(TV
series\)")_ premiered on October 8, 2017, on [CBS](/wiki/CBS "CBS") in the
United States.[1] It is produced by [CBS Television
Studios](/wiki/CBS_Television_Studios "CBS Television Studios"), and
[Revelations Entertainment](/wiki/Revelations_Entertainment "Revelations
Entertainment") with series creator [Barbara
Hall](/wiki/Barbara_Hall_\(TV_producer\) "Barbara Hall \(TV producer\)")
serving as executive producer, alongside [Morgan Freeman](/wiki/Morgan_Freeman
"Morgan Freeman"), [Lori McCreary](/wiki/Lori_McCreary "Lori McCreary"), and
Tracy Mercer.

##
Cast[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Madam_Secretary_\(season_4\)&action=edit&section=1
"Edit section: Cast")]

  * [Téa Leoni](/wiki/T%C3%A9a_Leoni "Téa Leoni") as Dr. Elizabeth McCord, the [United States Secretary of State](/wiki/United_States_Secretary_of_State "United States Secretary of State")
  * [Tim Daly](/wiki/Tim_Daly "Tim Daly") as Dr. Henry McCord, Elizabeth's husband and a [National Security Agency](/wiki/National_Security_Agency "National Security Agency") operative
  * [Keith Carradine](/wiki/Keith_Carradine "Keith Carradine") as Conrad Dalton, [President of the United States](/wiki/President_of_the_United_States "President of the United States")
  * [Erich Bergen](/wiki/Erich_Bergen "Erich Bergen") as Blake Moran, Elizabeth's [personal assistant](/wiki/Personal_assistant "Personal assistant")
  * [Patina Miller](/wiki/Patina_Miller "Patina Miller") as Daisy Grant, Elizabeth's [press coordinator](/wiki/Press_secretary "Press secretary")
  * [Geoffrey Arend](/wiki/Geoffrey_Arend "Geoffrey Arend") as Matt Mahoney, Elizabeth's [speechwriter](/wiki/Speechwriter "Speechwriter")
  * [Sebastian Arcelus](/wiki/Sebastian_Arcelus "Sebastian Arcelus") as Jay Whitman, Elizabeth's [policy advisor](/wiki/Senior_Advisor "Senior Advisor") and later [chief of staff](/wiki/Chief_of_staff "Chief of staff")
  * [Sara Ramirez](/wiki/Sara_Ramirez "Sara Ramirez") as Kat Sandoval, Elizabeth's new policy advisor
  * Kathrine Herzer as Alison McCord, Elizabeth and Henry's younger daughter
  * [Evan Roe](/wiki/Evan_Roe "Evan Roe") as Jason McCord, Elizabeth and Henry's son
  * [Wallis Currie-Wood](/wiki/Wallis_Currie-Wood "Wallis Currie-Wood") as Stephanie "Stevie" McCord, Elizabeth and Henry's older daughter; later, Dmitri's girlfriend
  * [Željko Ivanek](/wiki/%C5%BDeljko_Ivanek "Željko Ivanek") as Russell Jackson, [White House Chief of Staff](/wiki/White_House_Chief_of_Staff "White House Chief of Staff")
  * Chris Petrovski as Dmitri Petrov, a former Russian spy who joins the National Security Agency to work for Henry
  * [Bebe Neuwirth](/wiki/Bebe_Neuwirth "Bebe Neuwirth") as Nadine Tolliver, Elizabeth's chief of staff

##
Episodes[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Madam_Secretary_\(season_4\)&action=edit&section=2
"Edit section: Episodes")]

See also: [List of Madam Secretary
episodes](/wiki/List_of_Madam_Secretary_episodes "List of Madam Secretary
episodes")

No.  
overall | No. in  
season | Title | Directed by | Written by | Original air date | U.S. viewers  
(millions)  
---|---|---|---|---|---|---  
69 | 1 | "News Cycle" | [Morgan Freeman](/wiki/Morgan_Freeman "Morgan Freeman") | [Barbara Hall](/wiki/Barbara_Hall_\(TV_producer\) "Barbara Hall \(TV producer\)") | October 8, 2017 (2017-10-08) | 7.21[2]  
At the United Nations General Assembly, Elizabeth meets with the assistant
vice minister of Timor-Leste, who suddenly collapses and dies. When the
president of Timor-Leste has the minister's body returned to their home
country before an autopsy can be performed, Elizabeth has Will look into the
minister's death. Meanwhile, Alison moves away to college, and Dmitri becomes
a CIA operative.  
70 | 2 | "Off the Record" | [Eric Stoltz](/wiki/Eric_Stoltz "Eric Stoltz") | David Grae | October 15, 2017 (2017-10-15) | 6.36[3]  
The situation in Libya is worsening, and Elizabeth helps negotiate a cease
fire after she gains the confidence of both sides, following an car incident
and the rescue of a local girl.  
71 | 3 | "The Essentials" | [Charlotte Brandstrom](/wiki/Charlotte_Brandstr%C3%B6m "Charlotte Brandström") | Matt Ward | October 22, 2017 (2017-10-22) | 6.43[4]  
The President is negotiating with Congress to avoid a government shutdown.
Elizabeth works with her team to bring electric power to a refugee camp in
Lebanon. Henry tracks down Dimitri, who was trying to wean himself off of pain
drug addiction, and drives him to a rehab clinic. Nadine decides to take a
leave and not come back to be close to her son and a future grandchild.  
72 | 4 | "Shutdown" | [Felix Alcala](/wiki/F%C3%A9lix_Enr%C3%ADquez_Alcal%C3%A1 "Félix Enríquez Alcalá") | Joy Gregory | October 29, 2017 (2017-10-29) | 5.83[5]  
The government shutdown continues; Elizabeth negotiates an agreement, while
picking a replacement for Nadine.  
73 | 5 | "Persona Non Grata" | John Murray | Alexander Maggio | November 5, 2017 (2017-11-05) | 5.92[6]  
Elizabeth organizes a human trafficking summit in Kyrgyzstan. Her ambassador
there is declared persona non grata for having an affair with a family member
of the presidential family, who eventually turns out to be a Russian spy.
Allison has doubts about her college direction, and Henry helps her to stay on
track.  
74 | 6 | "Loophole" | [Maggie Greenwald](/wiki/Maggie_Greenwald "Maggie Greenwald") | [Moira Kirland](/wiki/Moira_Kirland "Moira Kirland") | November 12, 2017 (2017-11-12) | 6.63[7]  
Henry disagrees with Elizabeth about not paying for ransoms for an agent kept
prisoner by the Taliban. Stevie has split from Jareth and has a hard time.  
75 | 7 | "North to the Future" | Sunu Gonera | Kristi Korzec | November 19, 2017 (2017-11-19) | 5.86[8]  
Elizabeth works with the Russians to fight an outbreak of smallpox. Jason is
in love.  
76 | 8 | "The Fourth Estate" | Sam Hoffman | Matt Chester | November 26, 2017 (2017-11-26) | 5.82[9]  
Elizabeth and her staff work with the Mexican government to extradite a drug
trafficker. Stevie starts dating Dmitri.  
77 | 9 | "Minefield" | Rob Greenlea | Matt Ward | December 10, 2017 (2017-12-10) | 6.45[10]  
Elizabeth works on treaty to eliminate field mines. Henry uncovers a Russian
spy within the senate.  
78 | 10 | "Women Transform the World" | Eric Stoltz | Lyla Oliver | December 17, 2017 (2017-12-17) | 5.53[11]  
Elizabeth organizes a conference for women. The government is working on the
situation inAfghanistan.  
79 | 11 | "Mitya" | [Geoffrey Arend](/wiki/Geoffrey_Arend "Geoffrey Arend") | Alexander Maggio | January 7, 2018 (2018-01-07) | 6.11[12]  
Elizabeth is working on the Russian ban on child adoption. Dmitri/Alexander is
being followed by a Russian spy intent on killing him.  
80 | 12 | "Sound and Fury" | Debbie Reinsich | Barbara Hall & David Grae | January 14, 2018 (2018-01-14) | 7.25[13]  
The Bulgarian embassy is attacked with a sound-wave weapon, and the President
overreacts.  
81 | 13 | "Reading the Signs" | Phil Bertelsen | Moira Kirland | March 11, 2018 (2018-03-11) | 6.28[14]  
Elizabeth has to deal with a psychic in her diplomatic efforts with Sri Lanka.
Alison's roommate attempts suicide.  
82 | 14 | "Refuge" | Eric Stoltz | Kristi Korzec | March 18, 2018 (2018-03-18) | 5.72[15]  
Jay and Kat work together to fight oppression against the LBGTQ community in
Abkhazia.  
83 | 15 | "The Unnamed" | Felix Alcala | Joy Gregory | March 25, 2018 (2018-03-25) | 6.14[16]  
A humanitarian crisis in Myanmar takes place while its president is visiting
in Washington. At the same time the President is having second thoughts about
going back to the office after his recovery. Henry is reconnecting with his
sister.  
84 | 16 | "My Funny Valentine" | Rob Greenlea | Matt Ward | April 1, 2018 (2018-04-01) | 5.75[17]  
Around the anniversary of a terrorist bombing of the US Embassy in Uganda,
emotions run high.  
85 | 17 | "Phase Two" | [Martha Mitchell](/wiki/Martha_Mitchell_\(director\) "Martha Mitchell \(director\)") | Leland Jay Anderson | April 8, 2018 (2018-04-08) | 6.19[18]  
Elizabeth McCord faces unforeseen trouble with the second phase of the Iranian
peace talks. Morejon strikes again.  
86 | 18 | "The Friendship Game" | Sam Hoffman | Lyla Oliver | April 22, 2018 (2018-04-22) | 6.06[19]  
Negotiations for an agreement to combat gang violence in South America become
complicated when the US's partner is complicit in a kidnapping. Elizabeth
worries she is no longer fun.  
87 | 19 | "Thin Ice" | Felix Alcala | Moira Kirkland & Alexander Maggio | April 29, 2018 (2018-04-29) | 6.03[20]  
88 | 20 | "The Things We Get to Say" | Sunu Gonera | Joy Gregory | May 6, 2018 (2018-05-06) | 5.91[21]  
89 | 21 | "Protocol" | Charlotte Brandstrom | Matt Ward | May 13, 2018 (2018-05-13) | 5.90[22]  
90 | 22 | "Night Watch" | Rob Greenlea | Barbara Hall & David Grae | May 20, 2018 (2018-05-20) | 6.22[23]
